Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There didn't need to be too much that was good about this film. The ballroom dancing was super cool too. I learned so much about it. I loved the costume design and the choice of music used . Sometimes cut scenes should be a little longer definitely a must see for all people

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "My Own Private Idaho" by Gus Van Sant, and as parody "Stan and Ollie's Ex-Wife" starring Terry Gilliam.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when its owners move away, has taken to killing the local food supply, endangering all animals and wildlife in its path. With the help of local activist and animal lover (Karen Elizabeth Austin) a group of locals set off on quest to save the animals of the town
